page.title: 12Uley 50 years ago cont.
page.content: September. Uley School consisted of one building divided into five classrooms.The hall was one classroom,classroom 2 was was divided in half with a partition and a curtain divided classroom 1.If it was raining when the children got to school they would shelter in two wooden sheds.In these sheds coal and wood was sometimes stored.Every morning the caretaker would fill the iron stoves in each classroom with fuel.The toilets were outside,the boys in the top yard and the girls in the bottom yard.If it was too far to go home for lunch the children brought sandwiches.Their work was very difficult and at the end of each term all the work was sent off to be marked.The Headmaster did all the secretarial work himself and sometimes used the cane.
